item.title: Damage to my garden fence, 30th July
item.description:
Over a period of tone vandals have damaged my wooden garden fence and brick wall. They have knocked both over and are continuing to knock a third portion of the wall down as I write this report. Can CCTV be installed to capture the individuals involved with a view to prosecuting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Riverside Road, North Cray, Sidcup, London

item.title: Urgent Clean-Up and Repair Needed at End of Chesterfield Gardens, 30th July
item.description:
I am writing to report ongoing issues with waste, cleanliness, and infrastructure at the end of Chesterfield Gardens, specifically behind the bollards. This area has become increasingly unhygienic and neglected. There is frequent littering, including bottles of urine, dog foul, and general rubbish. Street cleaners appear to be sweeping leaves and debris into this spot, which is now being misused as a dumping ground. Bags of rubbish are also being stored behind the bushes, further contributing to the mess. Additionally, the bollards at the front of this area are damaged, which may be enabling misuse and unauthorised access. I respectfully request that the Council: • Carries out a thorough clean-up of the area • Repairs or replaces the damaged bollards • Considers measures to deter further misuse (e.g., signage, surveillance, or increased patrols) This location requires immediate attention to restore safety and cleanliness for local residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Red Lion Yard, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very faded zebra crossing paint, 30th July
item.description:
The paint marking out the zebra crossing is very faded, and cars therefore regularly fail to stop for pedestrians, making this a more dangerous crossing. Recent roadworks resulted in a small part of the crossing being repainted, but all of the paint work needs to be redone.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holly Grove, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Three x Abandoned D-Locks outside, 30th July
item.description:
These Three x Abandoned D-Locks have been here slowly rotting for over six months. They look ugly and make it more difficult to park bicycles closely to the bicycle hoop. Can you please remove these abandoned D-Locks which are situated outside Bakerloo Underground Station - Southbank exit under the trees in front on the bus stops, Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70-72, London Road, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet
